page.title: 17LIFE YEARS AGO
page.content: We called on a man who has lived in Wickham Skeith for 69 years. We asked about the history of Wickham Skeith and we found out how transport has changed, there only used to be half a dozen cars in the village and now most people have cars. There used to be a water pump where a signpost is now. It was the man's nearest water supply. They used to water the horses with buckets of water from the Grimmer. He has worked on a farm all of his life. There used to be two horses to do the farming.They were fed at 5.00 a.m. so that they were ready to work on the land at 7.00 a.m. In the summer the horses slept in the meadow, they were stabled in the winter. It was a busy place on a farm long ago.
